cyclone.name: MARCO
cyclone.current_location: about 155 miles ESE of Cabo Gracias a Dios on the Nicaragua/Honduras border
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to turn northwest, cross the Yucatán Peninsula this weekend, then move into the south-central Gulf of Mexico and continue toward the north-western Gulf, aiming roughly at the Louisiana/Texas border early next week.

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Warning: Honduras/Nicaragua border westward to Punta Castilla including the Bay Islands, and from Puerto Cabezas, Nicaragua northward to the Honduras/Nicaragua border
weather_observation.warning_coast: Same as watch area – Central America only; no U.S. coastline warnings in effect
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Central America, Yucatán Peninsula, and the northern Gulf Coast from Texas to Florida Panhandle are within the potential impact area
weather_observation.wind: Low (15%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds beginning late Monday night or Tuesday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal water rise and higher seas possible, but significant surge (>3 ft) not expected
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rainbands could bring 1-3 inches of rain Tuesday, producing brief local flooding in low-lying areas
weather_observation.other_hazards: Elevated seas, rip currents, and possible short-term channel/harbor restrictions for vessel traffic
